definition: a thick earthenware pot or jar
coloring matter that rubs off from cloth or dyed leather

examples: the story in the paper is a crock

definition: to put or preserve in a crock
to transfer color (as when rubbed or washed)
examples: a suede that will not crock

definition: one that is broken-down, disabled, or impaired
examples: so many old … crocks with one foot in the grave

definition: a complaining medical patient whose illness is largely imaginary or psychosomatic
